thought: Wrong is spelled wrong in the dictionary.
A 'lethal dose' is also a 'lifetime supply'.
If you live to be 70 years old you will spend TEN YEARS of your life on Monday.
Nothing is on fire, fire is on things.
The letter ‘W’ is made of two ‘V’, but it is pronounced as double ‘U’; why so?
If ‘giver’ is the opposite of ‘taker’; then why do the words caregiver and caretaker mean the same thing?
